author: Special Correspondent
text:
A 16-year-old student was killed in a road accident in the city on Tuesday.

According to the police, the student died in an accident at Vepery around 10 a.m. on Tuesday. The youngster, Vittal Raj (16), is the son of Vincent, who works in the Department of Posts and lives at NH Road, Periamet. The victim was studying in class 12 at an Anglo-Indian school in the locality.

Vincent had purchased a motorcycle for his elder son, Williams, and Vittal Raj had taken it to appear for a practical exam. “When he was on the flyover near Doveton, he tried to overtake an MTC bus route 59 A. In the process, his vehicle hit the rear side of the bus and fell down. The bus dragged the motorcycle along with Vittal Raj for a short distance and stopped,” said a police officer attached to the Anna Square traffic investigation wing.

Not wearing a helmet

Since Vittal Raj was not wearing a helmet, he died on the spot.

The police arrested bus driver Bhaskaran (52). Further probe is on. “We warn schools and parents not to encourage minors to ride motorcycles. But the practice continues,” an officer said.

Vittal Raj (16) was on a flyover when his motorcycle hit the rear side of a bus and fell down
title: School student killed on way to exam venue
